title: IMPORTANT NOTICE -- When the cat's away...
content:
... everybody'd better behave. :^)

I'm [off for a week](http://web.archive.org/web/20121102080607/http:/www.moroccanhousehotels.com/) (with Sabine, without the kids -- it's been six years) so don't mind the mess.

See y'all in 8.
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content:
Thank god for grandparents Yves!

ChrisL

Good grief, I never thought I'd see the day!  
Have a great time, dad.  
...and let the party begin!

I love that name Sabine!!! There was a French black&white movie about a love triangle- the daughters name was Sabine. I loved that name ever since I watched the movie... I remembered Sabine but forgot the title... anyone remember the movie???

Mikey
I guess the movie was "Jules et Jim", by François Truffaut, with Jeanne Moreau, Oskar Werner and Henri Serre. The role of the daughter was played by Sabine Haudepin.

Berg\> Thank you! That's cool that the actress playing the daughter used her own name for the movie.

Mikey :-)

Can anybody say... FREE WIRELESS INTERNET!!! :^D

Carry on, don't mind me, I'm not even supposed to _be_ here.. ;^)

Well Yves... That's not how you're supposed to spend you holidays!

I hope you're enjoying yourself down there though! I'm sure the weather'll be tons better 8)

Yves, You are supposed to be spending 8 days with Sabine, not with us! :-)

ChrisL

BC- i hope you have a great vacation. 6 years? that's nuthin'. anyway -- enjoy.

on a side note, i always told myself that if i showed up as a "prolific poster" i would have to step back. today i made the list. so i'm gonna log out for a while myself.

now i am confused; do you have free wireless internet in your hotel or are you referring to the amaizing new technolodgy google is now offering:

[http://www.google.com/tisp/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121102080607/http:/www.google.com/tisp/ "http://www.google.com/tisp/")

muahaha
Hah, that's a good one! But I know _everything_ about [amazing new technology](http://web.archive.org/web/20121102080607/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=165)... O:^)
Maybe you should be concentrating on amazing new opportunities since six years?

But that's how he ended up with the kids to begin with! :-P

ChrisL

Aw, it's just that I can't cope with downtime. Whenever Sabine takes a cigarette break or is busy in the bathroom or goes to sleep when I'm not tired at all, I just pop up the computer for sometimes even five minutes. Give me a break. :^P
Hey, I managed to only check in once when I was gone -- the least you can do is find something more constructive to do that pop in here.... ;-)

Never take your computer on holiday - that's the point of holidays. Yves, force yourself to put it in the hotel safe, and no matter how much you plead, don't allow the staff to let you have it until you leave.

Now go and soak up the culture!

Nick Cooke
